description: A message that appears when the Annotation menu is opened but no Annotation fields have been created in the project settings.
Button label to take the user to the settings area of the application
Error message displayed when it's not possible to save metadata due to a required field not being filled in.
defaultMessage: Could not save, missing required field

description: Error message displayed when a URL is not in the correct format in the form, which prevents the form from being saved.
defaultMessage: Could not save, at least one URL is invalid

description: This is a label that indicates when and by whom the task was saved.
This message tells the user that the content typically shown in unavailable when the item is in the trash
This is a prompt that appears when a user tries to exit a page before saving their work.
defaultMessage: You are currently editing annotations. Do you wish to continue to a new page? Your work will not be saved.

description: This is a prompt that appears when a user tries to exit a page before saving their work.
defaultMessage: Do you want to leave without saving?

description: This is a label on a button at the top of a form. The label indicates that if the user presses this button, the user will save the changes they have been making in the form.
This is a label on a button that the user presses in order to revert/cancel any changes made to an unsaved form.
This is a label on a button that the user presses in order to edit the items in the attached form.
